page.title: 01GENERAL BACKGROUND
page.content: -GENERAL BACKGROUND TO OUR BLOCK- Our block of study has within it two fairly populated areas - 02700344 -includes the eastern part of the slate-quarrying town of Blaenau Ffestiniog known as MANOD. The other populated area is the western part of the village of Ffestiniog (02700342). Most of the block comprises of grazing land and woodlands of conifers and deciduous trees. Higher ground consists of the rugged slopes of Y MANOD mountain and the volcanic bubble known as MOEL YSTRADAU (02680342). Close to Moel Ystradau is the C.E.G.B.'s hydro-electric power station reservoir -LLYN YSTRADAU. CWMBOWYDD VALLEY is a scenic spot that runs through 6944, 6943 down to the VALE OF MAENTWROG 6942. Small farmesteads (50-100acres) for sheep-grazing can also be seen.
